questions.question_text: When creating a check payment, from where is the payment document defaulted?

discussion.content: A. identification of errors with clear error messages at the invoice header and line levels
C. ability to correct errors and re-import invoices directly from a spreadsheet

questions.question_text: What are the two advantages of using a spreadsheet for correcting invoice import errors?

choices.C: ability to correct errors and re-import invoices directly from a spreadsheet
choices.D: ability to correct errors within the spreadsheet and send invoice corrections for approval
choices.E: ability to enter a high volume of invoices via a spreadsheet
choices.A: identification of errors with clear error messages at the invoice header and line levels
choices.B: identification of errors with clear error messages at the invoice header level only

questions.question_text: You created a payment and before it is cashed by the supplier you mistakenly submitted a request to stop payment. Later you canceled the request to stop payment. What is the resulting payment status?

discussion.content:
A payment was created and ready to be cashed by a supplier.

A request to stop a payment was canceled.

A bills payable payment matured and you submitted the Update Matured Bills Payables Status process to change the payment status from Issued to Negotiable.

questions.question_text: Select three reasons why you cannot close your Payables period.

discussion.content:
Reasons:

Unaccounted invoices

Unaccounted payment activity

Bills payable requiring maturity event and accounting

Incomplete payment process requests

Open intercompany transactions

Other exceptions
i think as per link reference it should be B,D,E

answer B

You can enable expense auditors to audit expense reports for specific business units by assigning them specific expense auditor data roles for the business units. For example, to allow an expense auditor to audit expense reports for the Vision Operations and Vision Services business units, assign the Expense Auditor Vision Operations and Expense Auditor Vision Services data roles, respectively, to the expense auditor.

questions.question_text: You want your expense auditors to audit only expenses reports for specific business units. How do you do this?

choices.B: Assign the auditors specific data roles for the corresponding business units.
choices.D: Make auditors the managers of the corresponding business unit to route expense reports properly.
choices.C: Create your own audit extension rules that correspond to the business unit.
choices.A: Create a custom duty role and assign the data roles to each auditor.
